Title: Liberty Falling
Description: Liberty Falling is a fictional, but accurate account of a true mountain family of the Civil War era surviving on the western slopes of Sharptop Mountain. A tragic accident leaves the father unable to provide for the family, forcing his three young sons to assume all household responsibilities. When the Union Army pours over the Peaks of Otter on their campaign to take Lynchburg, the boys become separated from their home. The two eldest set out on a trek for help from the Confederate Army rumored to be in Lynchburg. Their journey carries them through the many sights of the county and city, and ultimately leads them to a timely meeting with the army's commanders. Being granted return passage home, the brothers get caught up in a brutal cavalry skirmish as General Hunter's army approaches. The tragedies and unforeseen revelations that follow cause their trip to come full circle through the devastated town of Liberty and back to the concerned family and community that so anxiously been waiting
Author: G.L. McIver

Title: The Bedford Boys
Description: June 6, 1944: Nineteen boys from rural Bedford, Virginia, died in the first bloody minutes of D-Day. They were part of Company A of the 116th Regiment of the 29th Division, and among the first wave of American soldiers to hit the beaches at Normandy. Later in the campaign, three more boys from this small Virginia community died of gunshot wounds.
Author: Alex Kershaw

Title: Lee's Last Casualty
Description: Lee's Last Casualty is the life and letters of Sgt. Robert W. Parker who served in the Second Virginia Cavalry during the Civil War. He is purported to have been the last man to be shot at the battle of Appomattox.
Author: Edited By Catherine M. Wright

Title: Remnants of War
Description: Civil War Records Bedford County, Virginia
Author: Ann Chilton

Title: The Government Girls of WWII
Description: The Government Girls of WWII, tells story of an eighteen-year-old girl from Bedford working in Washington, D.C. The book also provides a glimpse of what women working in  Washington, D.C. did during the Second World War.
Author: Margaret Krantz Parks

Title: A Girls Life in Virginia Before the War
Description: A true story of a young girls life lived in Virginia Bedford during the Civil War. Excerpts from the diary of Letitia B. Burwell to her nieces were complied and put together to give an accurate depiction of A Girl's Life of Virginia Before the War
Author: Letitia B. Burwell

Title: Confederate Treasure Coverup
Description: An 1885 booklet published in Lynchburg told of treasure buried in Virginia by Thomas J. Beale, with the location defined by cipher cryptograms. Millions of TV viewers know of the mystery from special programs on Fox TV, History Channel, Travel Channel, BBC and even Seoul Broadcasting. But the puzzle has defied solution. Is the treasure real? Where did it come from? Where is it now? This novel is the untold story of who put it there, how they did it, what became of it, and what became of them.
Author: Peter Viemeister

Title: Bedford Goes to War
Description: Bedford County Virginia is a small rural community at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Southwestern Virginia. It is picturesque with mountains and rolling hills and the quaint county seat of Bedford. Its people are friendly, hardy and patriotic. World War II more than any other war since the Civil War would test the community's patriotism and mettle. Bedford would more than pass muster both on the battlefield and on the home front.
Author: James W. Morrison

Title: Peter Lee Huddleston
Description: In 1861, a young Peter Huddleston helped form Bedford's Piedmont Rangers, an infantry company of volunteers. The unit was thrust into action at Manassas in the first major engagement of America's Civil War. Following the end of his year's enlistment, Peter joined Company A, Second Virginia Cavalry, and kept a diary though the years he fought from Fredericksburg to Gettysburg and in Lee's last charge, at Appomattox. Peter's guiding principle was duty, and when he was later elected Bedford County Sheriff, the courage of the battlefield would again be called for when a mob formed at Cifax and rode to Bedford City to lynch an accused man in Sheriff Huddleston's jail.
Author: Mary Collier

Title: Our War
Description: In Our War, June Goode brings together accounts and records of the Civil War in Bedford Virginia, from local diaries, letters, newspaper clippings, local stories and other sources. Lettie Burwell's absorbing Journal gives many details of the life for the citizens at this time in history and is presented in its entirety.
Author: June B. Goode

Title: The Otey, Ringgold and Davidson Virginia Artillery
Description: Part of the Virginia Regimental History Series.   By Robert J. Driver, Jr. and Kevin C. Ruffner. This series is dedicated to the men who served in Virginia Units during the War Between the States.  It is the purpose of this series to preserve, as a part of our heritage, the deeds and sacrifices of these men.  Your support of this project is greatly appreciated.  1st edition, 1996

Title: The Charlottesville Lee Lynchburg and Johnson's Bedford Artillery
Description: Part of the Virginia Regimental History Series.   By Robert J. Driver, Jr. and Kevin C. Ruffner. This series is dedicated to the men who served in Virginia Units during the War Between the States.  It is the purpose of this series to preserve, as a part of our heritage, the deeds and sacrifices of these men.  Your support of this project is greatly appreciated.  1st edition, 1996

Description: Part of the Virginia Regimental History Series.   By Robert J. Driver, Jr. and Kevin C. Ruffner. It is the purpose of this series to preserve, as a part of our heritage, the deeds and sacrifices of these men.  Your support of this project is greatly appreciated.  1st edition, 1996

Title: In the Foothills: The Life of Keytown Moves On
Description: The following excerpts were taken from the family book “Peaks of Otter Foothills—Keytown and Home” by  Patsy Croft Key Claytor:     As you can see, there were sixteen of us children—eight boys and eight girls. We had our own ball team. We had our ups and down. But the best part of all was growing up together and having a big family.      Our father was a farmer and he had a sawmill. In his early life, he worked in a silk mill and hauled produce to the market that was raised on the farm. In later life, he raised beef cattle.
Author: Patsy Key Claytor

Title: Indian Island
Description: The story of Virginia's Monacan tribe is one of American Indian's lost cultures, recently rediscovered. Once a flourishing Siouan confederacy, thriving in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, These forgotten people plunged into a cultural disarray before their history was accurately recorded. The state of Virginia, over the past century, officially ignored their existence, and that denial-of -existence created further social confusion among them. A study of these brave people emerges as a metaphor of similar plights among other Blue Ridge kinsmen to reclaim their heritage. This book will explain how a brave, determined people, whose history was on the brink of extinction, sprang from the ashes of cultural obscurity.
Author: Peter W. Houck and Mintcy D. Maxham

Title: The Mills of Bedford County Vol. 1
Description: A brief history of the Mill's of Bedford County
Author: Bedford Museum

Title: The Mills of Bedford County Vol. 2
Description: A brief history of the Mills that have lived in Bedford County
Author: Bedford Museum

Title: The Buffalo Ridge Cherokee
Description: In this thoroughly researched and well-documented book, Dr. Rice brings to light the long neglected Cherokee heritage of the people living in the Buffalo Ridge area of Stapleton, Virginia. Although the people themselves, as well as their neighbors in Amherst County, are aware of their Native American heritage such things as their early assimilation of modern dress the prejudice of outsiders, and what Dr. Rice calls a Paper Genocide of Shoddy and Deceptive census and civil record keeping in the state, have kept this remnant of the divided Cherokee nation rather an obscure and forgotten part of Native American culture
Author: Horace R. Rice

Title: Bedford Images Old and New
Historical Diary of Bedford Virginia
Description: A history year by year in Bedford Virginia giving brief descriptions of  each of the years.
Author: Peter Viemeister

Title: Strangers in Their Midst
Description: This book presents a historical overview of the free Negro in Virginia from the mid-eighteenth century through the Civil War, along with the physical and historical background of Amherst County. The original edition preserved a wealth of information on nearly 1,200 free persons of color who lived in Amherst County prior to the Civil War. This second edition contains well over 350 new names. In addition, more than a hundred names from the previous book have been expanded with new information. An entire chapter dealing with the history of slaves and free colored persons in Virginia has been substantially enlarged

Title: Give Your Family A Gift That Money Can't Buy
Description: Over the years everyone has heard family stories and accumulated first hand information about their family that future descendants would just love to know. While your children, grandchildren, nieces and nephews might not be very interested now, someday they will be. Now is the time for you to preserve this valuable information. Jeffery A. Bockman has been researching his family since 1988 and writing and lecturing about family history since 1996. He is grateful that many of his ancestors had their picture taken and that others had the foresight to write the person's name on the back and hand them down to future generations along with numerous important papers. His inheritance was a collection of interesting ancestors, numerous photographs, a variety of unique record, and a few family stories. He hopes that everyone will be as kind to his or her own descendants and family members.
Author: Jeffrey A. Bockman

Title: Sketch Book of Liberty Virginia
Description: The central town of Bedford County Virginia was once named Liberty. Many of the buildings described and illustrated in this Sketchbook of Liberty of 1887, have been preserved and may be seen today. the natural Beauty and character of the area continues to attract visitors who return again and again. In 1782, on donated land and with a new log courthouse, the new town Liberty superseded New London as Bedford County's the seat of government. liberty flourished for more than a century and changed itself to Bedford City in 1890. It reverted to town status in 1912. In 1968, it became the City of Bedford. In 1993 the place was recognized as "one of the best small towns in America

Title: The Early Life of Booker T. Washington
Description: A century after his death, Dr. Booker T. Washington's legacy lives on in the educational institution established for the instruction and uplift of African-American students, Tuskegee University, and in the expansion of educational opportunities throughout the South. Yet, historical scholarship has yielded little knowledge on the origins of Prof. Washington. Various aspects of his birth and life in bondage on a tobacco plantation in remote piedmont Virginia has remained largely a mystery until now. This recent work illuminates Booker T. Washington's birth and early life based entirely on new research and will promote further scholarship into the dynamic of the Sage of Tuskegee.
Author: John H. Whitfield

Title: Roster of Confederate Soldiers of Bedford County
Description: A complete listing of Confederate Soldiers from Bedford County, VA. It list the unit in which they served, their status and whether they received the Cross of Honor.

Title: Our Kin
Description: The genealogies of some of the early families who made history in the founding and development of Bedford County
Author: Ackerly and Parker

Title: Spirit of New London Academy
Description: A history of the New London academy and its impact on the local communities.

Title: The Peaks of Otter: Life and Times
Author: Peter Viemeister

Title: Goose Creek
Description: The clear waters of Goose Creek originate in Bedford, at Bearwallow Gap, and bisect the county as they gather strength and flow southeast, for fifty miles, toward Huddleston. This book engagingly presents the lives of the people who have relied on the creek, from the Monahassanoes to today. Stories of mining and mills, and of courage and character are told, and the splendid array of natural resources of the creek corridor is detailed.
Author: Mary Collier

Title: Parker's History of Bedford County, VA
Description: By Lula Jeter Parker, Hamilton’s Indexed Edition, 1988.  Back in 1954, Glenn Babb, Editor and owner of the Bedford Democrat, published The History of Bedford County, Virginia that had been compiled by Lula Jeter Parker.  The book became a reference.  This is a reprint of the original work with an all-new index to make this volume more useful than ever.
Author: Lula Jeter Parker

Title: Cedars of Cifax
Description: A history of the Cedars of Cifax, a plantation home. which includes genealogy of many Bedford families including Bush, Moore, Poindexter, White, and Rucker.
Author: Kathleen Bonnie Worsham

Title: Bedford Villages Vol. 1
Description: Compiled by the Peaks of Otter Chapter Daughters of the American Revolution.  This is volume I of a three volume set documenting villages which were large enough to have a post office.  Every effort was made to keep these volumes a place history; one of stores, taverns, mills, bridges, roads, name origin and the necessity which gave rise to a particular village in that place.
Author: DAR

Title: Bedford Villages Vol. 2
Description: Compiled by the Peaks of Otter Chapter Daughters of the American Revolution.  This is volume 2 of a three volume set documenting villages which were large enough to have a post office.  Every effort was made to keep these volumes a place history; one of stores, taverns, mills, bridges, roads, name origin and the necessity which gave rise to a particular village in that place.
Author: DAR

Title: Bedford Villages Vol. 3
Description: Compiled by the Peaks of Otter Chapter Daughters of the American Revolution.  This is volume 3 of a three volume set documenting villages which were large enough to have a post office.  Every effort was made to keep these volumes a place history; one of stores, taverns, mills, bridges, roads, name origin and the necessity which gave rise to a particular village in that place.
Author: DAR

Title: The Pathway Home
Description: This historical fiction takes the reader from the bloody battlefields of Gettysburg, through the burning of Lexington, Hunter's Raid into Liberty, the defense of Lynchburg, and ultimately to the surrender at Appomattox. Experience the war through the journal entries of a Union officer forced to participate in the destruction wrought upon Virginia's Shenandoah Valley. Witness the disruption of life between the Peaks of Otter on the Johnson Farm as a southern woman is confronted with 20,000 Union soldiers. Through her poignant journals experience the hardships of life in the South and the Confederacy's desperate plight.The authors' three years of historical research gives the reader an accurate depiction of both sides of the conflict and how war can bring two vastly different lives together. See history come alive through photos, period drawings and diagrams of the Johnson Farm as they are intertwined throughout the narrative.
Author: J.R. Parker

Title: Bedford County, Virginia Cemeteries
Description: The locations of many of Bedford, VA's cemeteries are provided in this book. For those seeking a relatives grave in Bedford County this is a must read
Author: Glenn Stevens

Title: Some Bedford County, VA Cemeteries Book II
Description: Glenn Stevens continuation of his work on finding Bedford's many cemeteries. Most of the cemeteries listed in this book are located in Bedford County, with just a couple of exceptions. Those cemeteries located on county lines adjoining Bedford County and have strong Bedford County ties. Names given to the cemeteries may not be the original name given, but a name was chosen perhaps from predominance of a family name, or from the oldest person buried within.
Author: Glenn Stevens

Title: The Leftwich-Turner Families of Virginia and Their Connections
Description: A brief history of the Leftwich-Turner Families of the Bedford Virginia area and the families that also connected to them.

Title: Wheeler's from Bedford Co, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Wheeler family of Bedford Co, VA
Author: Glenn Stevens

Title: Historical Diary of Bedford, VA
Description: A history year by year in Bedford Virginia giving brief descriptions of  each of the years.
Author: Peter Viemeister

Title: 1850 Bedford County, VA Census
Description: A list of the 1850 Census conducted in Bedford County Virginia
Author: Marvin U. Neighbors

Title: A History of Bedford County With Family Histories and Roster of Civil War Soldiers
Description: A brief history of Bedford County including Family History and a Roster of Civil War Soldiers

Title: Bedford County Will book 1&2
Description: Bedford County Will book 1&2
Author: Ann Chilton

Title: Bedford County Virginia Will Book Vol. 3
Description: A list of wills written in Bedford County Virginia in the years 1794-1810
Author: Ann Chilton

Title: The Padgetts and Goodmans of Virginia and Their Descendents
Description: A history of the Padgett and Goodman families
Author: Clark Inge

Title: Smith Mountain Lake Cemetery Relocation Project
Description: The story of the Smith Mountain Lake Cemetery Relocation Project. Every cemetery within the area to be flooded by the proposed Smith Mountain Lake needed to be moved and the people put in charge of the extensive project had no experience in large scale cemetery relocation. The narrative of how the process was undertaken is included beside a list and information about each and every cemetery that was surveyed and moved during the relocation process. A great addition to any genealogists library
Author: Beverly Merritt

Title: The Goff Family and  Their Kin
Description: A collection of stories and genealogical information on the Goff Family and the related branches of other families that connect with the Goff's.

Title: Echoes of Olde Liberty
Description: Echoes of Olde Liberty is not meant to be a history in the usual sense but only a glimpse back into the past of a little town that had its beginnings in Colonial times. If it inspires anyone to delve more searchingly into the story of our section of the state, then the time expended by this organization will not have been in vain. Every effort has been made to verify facts therein, but, in some instances, there are contradictions in old sources with respect to dates and happenings.

Title: Zimmerman's of Bedford-Botetourt Counties, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Zimmerman family of Bedford-Botetourt Counties, VA
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Brown Family in Franklin County, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Brown Family of Franklin County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Samuel Harris Descendants
Description: Genealogy of the descendants of Samuel Harris
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Bedford County, VA. Bowyers
Description: The Genealogy of the Bowyer Family of Bedford, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Laughons - Lawhorns of Bedford
Description: The Genealogy of the Laughon - Lawhorn Families of Bedford County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Our Dellis Family from Bedford County, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Dellis Family from Bedford County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Crouch's of Bedford County, VA.
Description: Genealogy of the Crouch Family of Bedford County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Dallas' leave Bedford County
Description: Genealogy of the Dallas family of Bedford County
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Descendants of Christopher Clark in Bedford/Campbell
Description: Genealogy of the descendants of Christopher Clark in Bedford/Campbell.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Descendants of Worley, Whorley in Bedford County, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Worley, Whorley family of Bedford County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Bedford County, VA. Bowlings
Description: Genealogy of the Bowling family of Bedford County, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Bedford County, VA Descendants of Thomas Quarles
Description: Genealogy of the descendants of Thomas Quarles
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: A Southside VA. Maxey Family
Description: Genealogy of a Southside, VA Maxey Family
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: A Lipscomb Family from Nottaway to Bedford, VA.
Description: Genealogy of the Lipscomb Family from  their origins in Nottaway to Bedford, VA.
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: The Lloyd's Came South
Description: Genealogy of the Lloyd Family in Bedford County, VA
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Wooldridge Descendants in Bedford County, VA
Description: Genealogy of the Wooldridge family from Bedford County, VA
Author: Glenn D. Stevens

Title: Bedford Black History: 250 Years
Lost at Thaxton
